Mr. Shuler helped to directly support the company Critical Infrastructure Protection Program by leading the effort to implement an incident response practice.  Mr. Shuler demonstrated tremendous expertise in learning, understanding and developing strategies to secure and react to incidents involving industrial control systems.  He has helped to define a forensics cyber security practice surrounding industrial control systems and has used his experience to lead others in learning and understanding these advanced control systems functionality including; the do's and do not's associated with securing them.  Mr. Shuler's attitude is terrific, positive and he continues to yearn to gain more knowledge and information.  He understands how to work with people in order to get the mission accomplished.

summary: Personable security professional with more than 15 years of experience building complex cultural relationships used in execution of strategic objectives.  Designs and executes program level assessments to identify cultural and technology gaps, leveraging results to build coordinated road maps of practices designed to meet organizational strategic goals and objectives.  Proficient at implementing coordinated activities that produce results that support the strategic vision.  Advanced understanding of Cyber Security concepts and principles, including experience implementing advanced malware solutions and overarching risk management programs based on the foundational principles outlined by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).• Successfully executed system identification and process classification procedures using a team based approach in a number of companies across the United States.• Established foundational programmatic elements for a number of clients in the development of Security Authorization programs including the development of; Systems Security Plans, Risk Assessments and full security life cycle documentation as articulated by NIST SP 800-37.• Led a team of cyber security engineers in execution of security compliance assessments for a number of security standards including; NIST, NEI, NERC, SOX, HIPAA, and others.  • Responsible for creation of an Incident Management portfolio that spanned enterprise organizations by connecting disparate processes and personnel that were not culturally aligned.• Led teams of penetration testers and vulnerability assessments for a number of companies.• Increasingly responsible for leading sales efforts by demonstrating organizational qualifications to clients to support development of strategic partnerships.
name: Daniel Shuler, CISSP, PMP
title: Information Security, Risk Management, Audit & Compliance Professional
